definition: to try to cover up in an embarrassing situation/to justify oneself/to find excuses
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor

sentences.english: And we love self-deprecating humor like we saw from the First Lady," says Mr. Lichtman.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢第一夫人那种自我解嘲的幽默。

sentences.english: And we love self- deprecating humor like we saw from the First Lady, " says Mr."
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢第一夫人那种自我解嘲的幽默。

sentences.english: Humor is the Ch'an mind of wis-dom that laughs at self, not others.
sentences.chinese: 幽默是睿智的禅心，它是自我解嘲，而非取笑别人。

sentences.english: I am afraid senilly, until realizes is obtaining the wisdom every day.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕嘲弄，直到学会自我解嘲。

sentences.english: I had no idea how to begin, except to laugh at myself.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么开始，只能自我解嘲。

sentences.english: Until I learned how to laugh at myself.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕嘲弄，直到我学会自我解嘲。

sentences.english: I was afraid of being jeer , till i learn how to jeer myself back.
sentences.chinese: 我本害怕嘲人，直到我学会如何自我解嘲。

sentences.english: I was afraid of being ridiculed , till I learn how to untie it myself.
sentences.chinese: 我本害怕嘲人，直到我学会如何自我解嘲。

sentences.english: I feared ridicule until I learned how to laugh at myself.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕嘲弄，直到学会自我解嘲。

sentences.english: He's even more willing to poke fun at himself.
sentences.chinese: 他现在甚至比较愿意自我解嘲了。

definition: to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor
appearing to be praising others while actually praising yourself/one's criticism of others exposes one's own faults
to compare oneself/to view oneself as
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to find some consolation (idiom)/to find relief in
